issue.title: msn.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://msn.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmsn.com) ### Comment Username: @mshea77 > Ads remain regardless of how AdGuard is set - MSN ads appear when using ad block, or when turning it off for the site. Previously I was able to block elements from the old adguard link that was available in the sub-menu. when trying to block ads from the new adguard extension that appears in the address bar, there is no way to select the element to block, either from the rotating ads at the top of the page, or from the banner in the middle of the page. i have been dealing with this for over a month and i cannot get any assistance from you guys whatsoever. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/bAkRzDB.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard/AdGuard Pro for iOS v4.4.4 Browser: | Safari DNS filtering: | server: `adguard`
Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

whatever this language is, i do not speak it…. more crap from adguard… and still nothing worksOn Apr 19, 2023, at 8:47 PM, Spok1 ***@***.***> wrote:﻿

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://msn.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmsn.com) ### Comment Username: @mshea77 > Ads remain regardless of how AdGuard is set - MSN ads appear when using ad block, or when turning it off for the site. Previously I was able to block elements from the old adguard link that was available in the sub-menu. when trying to block ads from the new adguard extension that appears in the address bar, there is no way to select the element to block, either from the rotating ads at the top of the page, or from the banner in the middle of the page. i have been dealing with this for over a month and i cannot get any assistance from you guys whatsoever. ### Screenshots

issue.title: example.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://example.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fexample.com%2F) ### Comment > Hello! > Help me please :) > > How can I block all third party requests? > > Rule: `||*^$third-party` not working:( ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/4eYY4Jq.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | - Browser: | - Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

comment.body: It seems like an extraordinarily bad idea to do anything like that, but simply `$third-party` *seems* to work for that.

> > @wm4biz Hi. I can't reproduce. Please open filtering log, reproduce an issue and make a screenshot. Is the problem caused by a specific filter, or when enabled AdGuard app + browser extension?
>

>

Hey @Alex-302 
Any update?
